snippet: The euro zone’s fourth-largest economy is too big to fail and possibly too big to steamroll, changing the balance of power in bargaining over a deal to rescue Spain’s ailing banks.
abstract: Bargaining begins over a deal to rescue Spain's ailing banks, confronting Europe with urgent choices about whether to try to enforce onerous bailout terms on the country; Spain's trump card is that consequences of a Spanish default and exit from the euro zone would probably be so catastrophic that policy makers will be willing to bend their bailout rules and are on the verge of doing just that.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Raphael Minder from Paris. Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt, Paul Geitner from Brussels, and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The euro zone’s fourth-largest economy is too big to fail and possibly too big to steamroll, changing the balance of power in bargaining over a deal to rescue Spain’s ailing banks.

headline.main: Spain Holds a Trump Card in Bank Bailout Negotiations
headline.print_headline: Spain Holds a Trump Card in Bank Bailout Talks
